WorkItem.ClosedComment: WPF Toolkit (October 2008 and January 2009) requires .NET 3.5 SP1.
WorkItem.Description:
I downloaded the source. When I compile, I get the following errors:
 
Error	1	The type or namespace name 'MultiSelector' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	     
                    (D:\MS\Toolkit-development\DataGrid\Microsoft\Windows\Controls\DataGrid.cs	32	29	WPFToolkit)
Error	2	The type or namespace name 'IEditableCollectionView' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	
                    (D:\MS\Toolkit-development\DataGrid\Microsoft\Windows\Controls\DataGrid.cs	2732	17	WPFToolkit)
Error	3	The type or namespace name 'IItemProperties' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	
                    (D:\MS\Toolkit-development\DataGrid\Microsoft\Windows\Controls\DataGrid.cs	5473	66	WPFToolkit
Error	4	The type or namespace name 'IItemProperties' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	
                   (D:\MS\Toolkit-development\DataGrid\Microsoft\Windows\Controls\DataGrid.cs	5494	45	WPFToolkit
Error	5	The type or namespace name 'ItemPropertyInfo' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)	 
                   (D:\MS\Toolkit-development\DataGrid\Microsoft\Windows\Controls\DataGridAutoGeneratingColumnEventArgs.cs	34	79	WPFToolkit
 
....
...
 
 
Also, does anyone have a test driver that I could use. I am new to VS environment, so I apologize if I'm doing something wrong.
 
Thanks
 
Sallu

Comments.Message:
Hi Sallu,

It sounds like maybe you haven't installed .NET 3.5 SP1.  The DataGrid is dependent on 3.5 SP1, so please install it here if you haven't already: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=ab99342f-5d1a-413d-8319-81da479ab0d7&DisplayLang=en

Thanks!
Samantha

Is it possible to compile this code with .NET 3.5 non sp1 as long as .net 3.0 sp2 is installed.

I looked at the changes, and it looks like all of the changes were added in .net 3.0 sp2.
